TopicTitle: "Eve: Order Zero" -- a KSP Graphic Novel (POSTLUDE COMPLETE...bet you didn't see THAT coming.)

Articles.Content:
[quote name='Kuzzter']  

Maybe. Well, if the Kerbulan ships ever do change color let's just assume they've always been that way, OK?[/QUOTE]  

I'm sure Bill Kermulan would suspect something had changed. Naturally, the others would assume he's talking nonsense.

Oooh. Gene Kermulan is particularly nasty.  

Good thing we don't think like him. It's a very good thing that we don't have agonizers!  

'One would think, Leader.' :D  

Happy landings!  

[SIZE=1]Hail the Empire[/SIZE]

[quote name='Starhawk']Good thing we don't think like him. It's a very good thing that we don't have agonizers![/QUOTE]  

If my wife had one, this thread would be a LOT shorter :)

If you're going to go the Star Trek sort of route, you should introduce the Kerlingons at some point. :) Just an idea.  

Whether the more ruthless TOS Klingons or the more honorable TNG/DS9 Klingons is up to you.

[quote name='Kuzzter']If my wife had one, this thread would be a LOT shorter :)[/QUOTE]  

I can't rep you for that, but, man, did I laugh.  

Happy landings!

So all of Duna Ore Bust and Eve: Order Zero is actually just fiction written by Kenlie Kermulan.   

[url]http://tvtropes.org/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AllJustADream[/url]  

[url]http://tvtropes.org/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OrWasItADream[/url] ???
Huh. So is Mort the plucky hero and leader of [url=http://tvtropes.org/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LaResistance]La RÃƒÂ©sistance[/url] in this broken mirror?

[quote name='Trios']So all of Duna Ore Bust and Eve: Order Zero is actually just fiction written by Kenlie Kermulan.   

[URL]http://tvtropes.org/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AllJustADream[/URL]  

[URL]http://tvtropes.org/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OrWasItADream[/URL] ???[/QUOTE]  

\*Tinfoil hat on\*

99% of human contiousness while beeing awake can be considered as "imagination".  

The remaining percent is routine.  

1% of human contiousness during sleep can be considered as "imagination",  

99% as routine.  

Recognize [I]yourself[/I].

[quote name='Trios']So all of Duna Ore Bust and Eve: Order Zero is actually just fiction written by Kenlie Kermulan.   

[URL]http://tvtropes.org/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AllJustADream[/URL]  

[URL]http://tvtropes.org/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OrWasItADream[/URL] ???[/QUOTE]  

[url]http://tvtropes.org/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MutuallyFictional[/url]?

[quote name='Sanic']\*Tinfoil hat on\*[/QUOTE]  

I'm not saying it was aliens, but...  

[IMG]http://s2.quickmeme.com/img/0e/0efe1af82450fb773d83ef6c87a2bf8a45820366ead58d6f1fa168946ca5d0aa.jpg[/IMG]
I'm wondering how long until we meet Kenline, from the [URL="http://tvtropes.org/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RuleSixtyThree"]Rule 63[/URL] universe.

[quote name='smjjames']If you're going to go the Star Trek sort of route, you should introduce the Kerlingons at some point. :) Just an idea.[/QUOTE]  

Actually, maybe I already have :) Does all this 'warrior' stuff sound like the Romulans, or someone else? Hey, if the ST movies can mash up the Klingons and Romulans for sake of expediency, I can mash those two, the 'Mirror, Mirror baddies', and maybe even Swiper from [I]Dora The Explorer[/I]. I'm just getting started!  

[quote name='Trios']So all of Duna Ore Bust and Eve: Order Zero is actually just fiction written by Kenlie Kermulan. [/QUOTE]  

Yup. If you liked it, don't forget to send him your rep! (he could use a pick-me-up after this agonization session... poor Kenlie :()  

[quote name='The Error']Huh. So is Mort the plucky hero and leader of [URL="http://tvtropes.org/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LaResistance"]La RÃƒÂ©sistance[/URL] in this broken mirror?[/QUOTE]  

You never know! One wonders what use the Kerbulans have for a finance guy.   

[quote name='Mikki']Recognize [I]yourself[/I].[/QUOTE]  

Whoa. That is some [I]serious '[/I]mirror', yo.  

[quote name='Parkaboy']I'm wondering how long until we meet Kenline, from the [URL="http://tvtropes.org/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RuleSixtyThree"]Rule 63[/URL] universe.[/QUOTE]  

Well THAT could get interesting. One thing I can assure you, I am NOT doing a Rule 34 universe. I kind of like the whole 'not-being-banned' thing.  

So at dinner tonight I told my daughter the rough outline of the next two books. Her advice to me: "Explain nothing. Let the comments section handle it." That's my girl! :D

[quote name='Kuzzter']So at dinner tonight I told my daughter the rough outline of the next two books. Her advice to me: "Explain nothing. Let the comments section handle it." That's my girl! :D[/QUOTE]  

Sounds like a chip off the ol' block. :D  

Happy landings!
Just as I had no idea! E:O0 and D:OB never happened!
I was reading a fiction by KENLIE?! Eww....

[quote name='Kuzzter']  

Yup. If you liked it, don't forget to send him your rep! (he could use a pick-me-up after this agonization session... poor Kenlie :()  

[/QUOTE]  

Better not send him any rep. Someone might take it as proofs he DOES have contact with an enemy of the Empire...

> 
> 
> 
> 
> Better not send him any rep. Someone might take it as proofs he DOES have contact with an enemy of the Empire...

Good point. In any case this should make things a bit clearer on what the various Kenlie Ks are actually seeing and writing... or maybe it won't ![:confused:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_huh.gif ":confused:")

**Edited <time datetime="2016-05-18T17:02:56Z" title="05/18/2016 05:02  PM" data-short="8 yr">May 18, 2016</time> by Kuzzter**

Beautifully done!  

I loved the 'kellycams' and 'krooton torpedoes'. Great laughs.  

And, of course, we've all been on the edge of our seats anticipating the first glimpse of facial hair. :)  

Happy landings!

**Edited <time datetime="2015-11-19T15:21:14Z" title="11/19/2015 03:21  PM" data-short="8 yr">November 19, 2015</time> by Starhawk**
Krooton torpedoes sounds like something I'd put on a salad, much fun! :)
Okay Kuzz, so you effectively ruined the entire Kerbfleet saga thing, the fact that the whole thing is written by Kenlie just makes it not enjoyable.

[quote name='Sharkman Briton']Okay Kuzz, so you effectively ruined the entire Kerbfleet saga thing, the fact that the whole thing is written by Kenlie just makes it not enjoyable.[/QUOTE]  

I don't think it is though. I think only this "opposite Kerbfleet" thing is written by Kenlie, and that everything else happened outside of them. Of course3, I still want to see where Kenlie's current writing project goes.

[quote name='Sharkman Briton']Okay Kuzz, so you effectively ruined the entire Kerbfleet saga thing, the fact that the whole thing is written by Kenlie just makes it not enjoyable.[/QUOTE]  

You do not seem to understand. I suggest you go find the classic Star Trek episode 'Mirror, mirror' and watch that.  

Happy landings!

[quote name='Sharkman Briton']Okay Kuzz, so you effectively ruined the entire Kerbfleet saga thing, the fact that the whole thing is written by Kenlie just makes it not enjoyable.[/QUOTE]  

It gets worse I'm afraid: if based on what you've just read Kenlie Kermulan created the whole Kerbfleet saga, then based on the events of the last Interlude, Kenlie Kerman invented the Kerbulans. What does [I]that [/I]mean? Well, I'll tell you... [spoiler]Kenlie created Kenlie but Kenlie created Kenlie but Kenlie created Kenlie and the whole thing disappears into some kind of vortex--[I]a[/I] [I]spacetime reality frappÃƒÂ©!!![/I][/spoiler]   

Sorry you're not enjoying it, Sharkman. I guess you don't trust me as an author :( Well, as a wise young woman advised me, "Explain nothing." I'm hoping the comments can help sort at all out.

You messed up the spoilers...  

So hopefully you mean that this will all be cleared up in the next part of it... By the way on that trust part, I don't read much fiction ever (Only fiction thats not on KSP I remember is Animal Farm, which was awesome)
